title: Revert is slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: When performing the Revert action in the Java editor, it takes significantly longer to replace the contents of the window with the original compared to closing and reopening the file.
OB:
After opening an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, if I mark the file as dirty by adding a space character at the end of the first line, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps:
1) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
2) Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
3) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: The Revert action should complete more quickly, ideally similar to the time it takes to close and reopen the file.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWT Custom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Add a space character at the end of the first line to mark the file as dirty.
3) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
4) Choose 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog.
5) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
6) Observe the time taken for the reopen action.
7) Repeat steps 1) and 2).
8) Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
9) Observe the time taken to replace the contents of the window with the original.
